SEARCH
Package com.otabi.jcodroneedu

Class JoystickData

java.lang.Object
com.otabi.jcodroneedu.JoystickData
public class JoystickData extends Object
Immutable data class representing joystick state from the CoDrone EDU controller.

This class provides a type-safe, Java-idiomatic way to access joystick data, recommended over the array-based Drone.getJoystickData() method.

Usage Example:


 // Recommended Java approach
 JoystickData joystickData = drone.getJoystickDataObject();
 System.out.println("Left stick: X=" + joystickData.getLeftX() + 
                    ", Y=" + joystickData.getLeftY());
 System.out.println("Right stick: X=" + joystickData.getRightX() + 
                    ", Y=" + joystickData.getRightY());
 System.out.println("Timestamp: " + joystickData.getTimestamp());
 
 // Use joystick values for control
 if (Math.abs(joystickData.getLeftY()) > 20) {
     System.out.println("Left stick moved vertically!");
 }

Joystick Values:

  • X and Y values range from -100 to 100
  • 0 represents neutral/center position
  • Positive Y = forward/up, Negative Y = backward/down
  • Positive X = right, Negative X = left
Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
  • Drone.getJoystickDataObject()

  • Constructor Details

    • JoystickData

      public JoystickData(int timestamp, int leftX, int leftY, int leftDirection, int leftEvent, int rightX, int rightY, int rightDirection, int rightEvent)
      Creates a new JoystickData instance.
      Parameters:
      timestamp - The timestamp in seconds when the joystick data was captured
      leftX - Left joystick X value (-100 to 100)
      leftY - Left joystick Y value (-100 to 100)
      leftDirection - Left joystick direction
      leftEvent - Left joystick event
      rightX - Right joystick X value (-100 to 100)
      rightY - Right joystick Y value (-100 to 100)
      rightDirection - Right joystick direction
      rightEvent - Right joystick event
